name: Senso
overview: Senso is a puzzle\memory game, developed by Harald Muller and published by Intersoft, which was released in Europe in 1993. It is modeled after the electronic Simon Says game from Hasbro. In it, players must repeat random sequences of colors by pressing the colored pads in the correct order. It's fast-paced play, with flashing colors and sounds that can challenge you. Experience the fun as you repeat the patterns and advance to higher levels. Keep track of your score as you challenge friends or try to beat your own high score. It was part of several classic collections such as Gamers' Delight.
